docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers in Big Sur-Monterey are trying to determine why, despite decades of efforts, the population is barely growing. Some blame pollutants, others a decline in food.

headline.seo: Sea Otters’ Failure to Thrive Confounds Researchers
headline.main: Pacific Sea Otters’ Failure to Thrive Confounds Wildlife Sleuths
headline.print_headline: Pacific Sea Otters’ Failure to Thrive Confounds Wildlife Sleuths

docs.abstract: Wildlife biologists in Monterey Bay area of California are trying to determine why, despite decades of efforts, the region's population of sea otters is barely growing; theories include the proliferation of pollutants and a decline in food supply.
docs.snippet: Researchers in Big Sur-Monterey are trying to determine why, despite decades of efforts, the population is barely growing. Some blame pollutants, others a decline in food.

docs.lead_paragraph: A study of older adults finds that those with higher omega-3 fatty acid levels had larger brain volume and performed better in tests of mental acuity.

headline.seo: Omega-3 Fatty Acid Levels Linked to Brain Performance
headline.main: Nutrition: Brainpower Tied to Omega-3 Levels
headline.print_headline: Nutrition: Brainpower Tied to Omega-3 Levels

docs.abstract: Dr Zaldy S Tan publishes study in journal Neurology finding that low blood levels of omega-3 fatty acids are associated with smaller brain volume and poorer performance on tests of mental acuity, even in people without apparent dementia.
docs.snippet: A study of older adults finds that those with higher omega-3 fatty acid levels had larger brain volume and performed better in tests of mental acuity.

docs.lead_paragraph: The advance from researchers at Massachusetts General Hospital could provide a new source of eggs for treating infertility.

headline.seo: Researchers Find Stem Cells Can Generate Human Eggs
headline.main: Scientists Use Stem Cells to Generate Human Eggs
headline.print_headline: Study Finds Stem Cells Can Create Human Eggs

docs.abstract: Researchers at Massachusetts General Hospital say they have extracted stem cells from human ovaries and made them generate egg cells; the advance, if confirmed, might provide a new source of eggs for treating infertility, though scientists say it is far too early to tell if the work holds such promise; the new research, led by the biologist Jonathan L Tilly, is published online by journal Nature Medicine.
docs.snippet: The advance from researchers at Massachusetts General Hospital could provide a new source of eggs for treating infertility.

docs.lead_paragraph: When Ronda Storms, a Republican state senator in Florida, is accused of nanny-state-ism for her efforts on behalf of a sane diet, it's worth noting. When she introduced a bill to prevent people in Florida from spending food stamps on unhealthy items like candy, chips and soda, she broke ranks: few of her party have taken on Big Food. And as someone who has called for the defunding of an educational Planned Parenthood program and banning library book displays supporting Gay and Lesbian Pride Month, she is hardly in her party's left wing. Not surprisingly, she's faced criticism from every corner: Democrats think she's attacking poor people, and Republicans seeMichelle Obama. Soon after Storms proposed the bill, she told me, ''Coca-Cola and Kraft were in my office'' hating it. Yet she makes sense. ''It's just bad public policy to allow unfettered access to all kinds of food,'' she told me over the phone. ''Why should we cut all of these programs and continue to pay for people to use food stamps to buy potato chips, Oreos and Mountain Dew? The goal is to feed good food to hungry people.''
docs.abstract: Mark Bittman Op-Ed column applauds Ronda Storms, a Republican state senator in Florida, who has introduced a bill to prevent people from spending food stamps on unhealthy foods; questions why government should not regulate diet, when it, along with tobacco and alcohol use, is one of the three main risk factors for chronic disease. (M)o
docs.snippet: When Ronda Storms, a Republican state senator in Florida, is accused of nanny-state-ism for her efforts on behalf of a sane diet, it's worth noting. When she introduced a bill to prevent people in Florida from spending food stamps on unhealthy items...

docs.abstract: The government regulates tobacco and alcohol. Why not diet?
